identificationModule.briefTitle: Microbe-host Interaction Relationship in Patients With Stroke-relatedPneumonia
identificationModule.officialTitle: Microbe-host Interaction Relationship in Patients With Stroke-related Pneumonia

leadSponsor.name: Guangzhou University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study intends to use a standardized cohort study to collect biological samples (including throat swabs, sputum and blood) from subjects eligible for inclusion, and use 16s DNA / metagenomic sequencing and metabolome technology to explore the microbial-host interaction relationship of SAP patients.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Stroke-related pneumonia (SAP) is the most common complication of acute cerebral hemorrhage, and it is one of the main causes of disease aggravation, prolonged hospitalization and costs, and even death. The traditional antibiotic model proved ineffective, and new prevention and treatment methods were urgently sought.This study intends to use a standardized and rigorous cohort study to collect biological samples (including throat swabs, sputum and blood) of eligible subjects, and to explore the microbial-host interaction relationship in patients with SAP, which may provide new targets and new ideas for the prevention and control of SAP.

bioSpec.description: All biological specimens (including throat swabs, sputum, blood) will be stored in the biological resource center of the study site after obtaining written informed consent from all subjects who volunteered to participate in the clinical study.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in the microbiota in throat swabs and sputum
primaryOutcomes.description: Microbiota changes in each set of throat swabs and sputum will be examined using 16s DNA / metagenome sequencing.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 3 days, 7 days, 14 days after enrollment, or at discharge

secondaryOutcomes.description: Utility-weighted modified Rankin scale score. Values range from 0 to 10: The higher the score, the better the result.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The European Quality of Life 5-Dimensional Questionnaire (EQ-5D-5L)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The EQ-5D includes five dimensions of health: mobility, self-care, ability to perform daily activities, pain and discomfort, and anxiety and depression. EQ-5D-5L, including five severity levels (none, minor, moderate, severe, serious, and extreme). Value range 0-100: The higher the score, the worse the result.
BI values range from 0-100: The higher the score, the better the result.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in the blood plasma metabolites
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ultra HPLC-tandem mass spectrometry will be used to test plasma metabolite expression in each group.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 3 days, 7 days, 14 days after enrollment, or at discharge

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: From December 2023 to December 2024, patients with new stroke at Guangdong Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine will be this study population. All eligible participants will be followed up for 90 days.
